title: Day 10 - Create Your Origins Story
mainPromise: You will craft a believable origin story and credibility set that makes your offer trustworthy without overselling.

teachings.title: Trust comes from specificity
teachings.content:
People do not trust big claims. They trust specific reasons. Your origin story should answer: why you noticed this problem, why you care, and why you can deliver a good result.

This is not a dramatic life story. It is a short explanation that makes your offer feel real. A simple, honest origin story can reduce buyer risk more than a long list of features.

Think in scenes. A scene is a moment where you saw the frustration clearly: a friend overwhelmed, a repeated issue in your own life, or a pattern you observed in work.
teachings.soWhat: If you cannot explain why you are doing this, your offer will feel generic and easy to ignore.

teachings.title: Credibility is proof of process
teachings.content:
Credibility is not bragging. It is showing that you have a method and boundaries. Buyers want to know you can deliver consistently.

Early credibility can be light: a clear process, a clear scope, and a clear deliverable list. If you have relevant experience, mention it briefly and concretely. If not, do not invent it. Use your evidence and your design choices.

A helpful credibility tool is a credibility set: three small proof points that can appear on a landing page or in a message.
teachings.soWhat: If you do not define credibility, buyers will assume risk and delay.

teachings.title: Prepare words you can reuse
teachings.content:
You will use your story and credibility in multiple places: a landing page, a DM, an email, and a payment page. If you write them once in reusable formats, you move faster later.

You need three reusable assets: a one-sentence pitch, a short paragraph pitch, and a message you can send to a potential buyer.

Each asset should reflect your customer language from Day 8 and your scope boundaries from Day 9.
teachings.soWhat: If you do not prepare reusable assets, you will rewrite from scratch every time you talk to someone.

doBlocks.title: Write your origin story draft
steps: Write a 3-part origin story: the scene, the insight, the decision.
End with one sentence that links to your offer outcome.

items.label: Wrote the scene in 2 to 3 sentences
Wrote the insight in 2 to 3 sentences
Wrote the decision and outcome link in 2 to 3 sentences
items.evidencePrompt: Paste your 2 to 3 sentence decision and outcome link.

items.label: Produced a single 120 to 170 word combined origin story
items.evidencePrompt: Paste the final origin story (120 to 170 words).

doBlocks.example: Scene: I watched a freelancer spend Sunday night rebuilding a plan from scratch again. Insight: The issue was not motivation. It was a messy system that kept breaking. Decision: I started packaging simple setups that remove weekly friction in 48 hours.

doBlocks.title: Build your credibility set
steps: Write your 5-step delivery process in plain language.
Write 3 credibility proof points that do not require testimonials.
Write one short bio line that matches the offer.

items.label: Wrote a 5-step delivery process
items.evidencePrompt: List 5 numbered steps describing your delivery process.

items.label: Wrote 3 credibility proof points
items.evidencePrompt: List 3 proof points that do not require testimonials.

items.label: Wrote one short bio line
items.evidencePrompt: Write a one-sentence bio aligned to the offer.

items.label: Wrote one what-I-will-not-do line
items.evidencePrompt: Write one sentence that sets expectations by stating what you will not do.

doBlocks.example: Proof points: Fixed intake form, fixed scope checklist, delivery within 48 hours. Bio line: I build simple digital workflows that save busy people time and reduce frustration.

doBlocks.title: Create your reusable scripts
steps: Write a one-sentence pitch with outcome and timeframe.
Write a 70 to 100 word paragraph pitch with deliverables.
Write a 6 to 9 line outreach message that invites a simple next step.

items.label: Wrote a one-sentence pitch
items.evidencePrompt: Paste your one-sentence pitch with outcome and timeframe.

items.label: Wrote a 70 to 100 word paragraph pitch
items.evidencePrompt: Paste your paragraph pitch (70 to 100 words).

items.label: Wrote a 6 to 9 line outreach message
items.evidencePrompt: Paste the outreach message (6 to 9 lines) inviting a simple next step.

items.label: Wrote a subject line or opener for your message
items.evidencePrompt: Write one subject line or opening line.

doBlocks.example: One-sentence pitch: In 48 hours, I set up a simple workflow that saves you time each week and stops the recurring admin mess. Opener: Quick question: are you still rebuilding your weekly plan from scratch?

outputs: Credibility set: 5-step process, proof points, bio, expectation setter
Reusable scripts: one-sentence pitch, paragraph pitch, outreach message
A clean language pack you can paste into pages and messages
wrap.tomorrowPreview: Next week you will start building the simple assets that let you validate demand and collect first customers without overbuilding.
